intro: Webera sechellensis, commonly known as the Seychelles hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Seychelles archipelago. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
